maker.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a person or company that makes a particular type of goods
maker.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The makers of the car claim that it uses up to 50% less fuel than other similar cars.
maker.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a machine or piece of equipment that makes something
maker.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Grind the beans to suit your coffee maker.
maker.translation[0].note_box[0].section: a company or person whose business is to make things to be sold, either by hand or using machines
We got a cabinet maker  (=someone who makes furniture from wood) to redo our kitchen for us.
a company or country that makes large quantities of something to be sold – often used about raw materials such as oil, coffee, or steel
OPEC is an organization of 13 major oil producers.
Gold producers' shares went up by 50%.
a company that makes things in large quantities, especially in a factory
Clothing manufacturers have been feeling the effects of the recession.
a person or company that makes ships or boats
a Japanese shipbuilder, Mitsubishi Heavy Industries
He started out as a boatbuilder.
maker.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Sony, one of the world’s biggest makers of portable audio equipment
The town hopes to attract major firms like car makers Honda.
The makers of the car claim that it uses up to 50% less fuel than similar cars.
